definition: lit. the solicitude of the crow (who provides for his old parent)(idiom)/fig. filial piety
abbr. for Ukraine 烏克蘭|乌克兰[Wu1 ke4 lan2]/surname Wu
crow/black
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
variant of 屌[diao3]/penis
personal/private/selfish
feeling/emotion/passion/situation
lit. an old ox licking its calf (idiom)/fig. (of parents) to dote on one's children
the love of a cow licking her calf (idiom)/parental love
to offer one's life in sacrifice
lit. the cow licking its calf fondly (idiom)/fig. to show deep affection towards one's children
to kill a pig as a lesson to the children (idiom); parents must teach by example
to repay sb's kind acts (idiom)
burning beanstalks to cook the beans (idiom); to cause internecine strife
if it's plowing, ask the laborer (idiom); when managing a matter, consult the appropriate specialist
see 父慈子孝[fu4 ci2 zi3 xiao4]
to correct in the evening a fault of the morning (idiom)/to quickly amend one's ways
to grieve for the sick and the dying/to show great concern for people's suffering
person narrow-minded and shortsighted
seeing to bed in the evening and visiting in the morning (ancient filial duty)
feelings deeper than for one's own flesh and blood (idiom)/deep friendship
common saying/folk proverb
Words of benevolence apply universally (idiom). Humanitarian expressions benefit all.
